wisdom.sentence: 100 invested at 7% interest for 100 years will become $100,000, at which time it will be worth absolutely nothing.
wisdom.author: Lazarus Long, "Time Enough for Love"

wisdom.sentence: 1st graffitiist: QUESTION AUTHORITY! 2nd graffitiist: Why?
A "No" uttered from deepest conviction is better and greater than a "Yes" merely uttered to please, or what is worse, to avoid trouble.
wisdom.author: Mahatma Ghandi

wisdom.sentence: A billion here, a billion there -- pretty soon it adds up to real money.
wisdom.author: Sen. Everett Dirksen, on the U.S. defense budget

wisdom.sentence: A bureaucrat's idea of cleaning up his files is to make a copy of everything before he destroys it.
A candidate is a person who gets money from the rich and votes from the poor to protect them from each other.
A citizen of America will cross the ocean to fight for democracy, but won't cross the street to vote in a national election.
wisdom.author: Bill Vaughan

wisdom.sentence: A Difficulty for Every Solution.
wisdom.author: Motto of the Federal Civil Service

wisdom.sentence: A diplomat is a man who can convince his wife she'd look stout in a fur coat.
A diplomat is a person who can tell you to go to hell in such a way that you actually look forward to the trip.
wisdom.author: Caskie Stinnett, "Out of the Red"

wisdom.sentence: A diplomat's life consists of three things: protocol, Geritol, and alcohol.
wisdom.author: Adlai Stevenson

wisdom.sentence: A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject.
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill

wisdom.sentence: A free society is one where it is safe to be unpopular.
wisdom.author: Adlai Stevenson

wisdom.sentence: A general leading the State Department resembles a dragon commanding ducks.
wisdom.author: New York Times, Jan. 20, 1981

wisdom.sentence: A government that is big enough to give you all you want is big enough to take it all away.
wisdom.author: Barry Goldwater

wisdom.sentence: A great empire, like a great cake, is most easily diminished at the edges.
wisdom.author: B. Franklin

wisdom.sentence: A great nation is any mob of people which produces at least one honest man a century.
A lack of leadership is no substitute for inaction.
A long memory is the most subversive idea in America.
A national debt, if it is not excessive, will be to us a national blessing.
wisdom.author: Alexander Hamilton

wisdom.sentence: A nuclear war can ruin your whole day.
A penny saved is a penny taxed.
A penny saved kills your career in government.
A political man can have as his aim the realization of freedom, but he has no means to realize it other than through violence.
wisdom.author: Jean Paul Sartre

wisdom.sentence: A prisoner of war is a man who tries to kill you and fails, and then asks you not to kill him.
wisdom.author: Sir Winston Churchill, 1952

wisdom.sentence: A real diplomat is one who can cut his neighbor's throat without having his neighbour notice it.
wisdom.author: Trygve Lie

wisdom.sentence: A real patriot is the fellow who gets a parking ticket and rejoices that the system works.
A right is not what someone gives you; it's what no one can take from you.
wisdom.author: Ramsey Clark

wisdom.sentence: A sect or party is an elegant incognito devised to save a man from the vexation of thinking.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson, Journals, 1831

wisdom.sentence: A statesman is a politician who's been dead 10 or 15 years.
wisdom.author: Harry S. Truman

wisdom.sentence: A straw vote only shows which way the hot air blows.
wisdom.author: O'Henry

wisdom.sentence: A strong conviction that something must be done is the parent of many bad measures.
wisdom.author: Daniel Webster

wisdom.sentence: Abraham Lincoln didn't die in vain.  He died in Washington, D.C.
Airplanes are interesting toys but of no military value.
wisdom.author: Marechal Ferdinand Foch, Professor of Strategy, Ecole Superieure de Guerre

wisdom.sentence: Alea iacta est.  [The die is cast]
wisdom.author: Gaius Julius Caesar

wisdom.sentence: Alexander Hamilton started the U.S. Treasury with nothing - and that was the closest our country has ever been to being even.
wisdom.author: The Best of Will Rogers

wisdom.sentence: All bad precedents began as justifiable measures.
wisdom.author: Gaius Julius Caesar, quoted in "The Conspiracy of      Catiline", by Sallust

wisdom.sentence: All diplomacy is a continuation of war by other means.
wisdom.author: Chou En Lai

wisdom.sentence: All kings is mostly rapscallions.   --Mark Twain
All other things being equal, a bald man cannot be elected President of the United States.
wisdom.author: Vic Gold

wisdom.sentence: All people are born alike -- except Republicans and Democrats.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.sentence: All the taxes paid over a lifetime by the average American are spent by the government in less than a second.
wisdom.author: Jim Fiebig

wisdom.sentence: America is the country where you buy a lifetime supply of aspirin for one dollar, and use it up in two weeks.
America may be unique in being a country which has leapt from barbarism to decadence without touching civilization.
wisdom.author: John O'Hara

wisdom.sentence: America: born free and taxed to death.
An ambassador is an honest man sent abroad to lie and intrigue for the benefit of his country.
wisdom.author: Sir Henry Wotton, 1568-1639

wisdom.sentence: An American's a person who isn't afraid to criticize the president but is always polite to traffic cops.
An efficient and a successful administration manifests itself equally in small as in great matters.
wisdom.author: W. Churchill

wisdom.sentence: Anarchy may not be a better form of government, but it's better than no government at all.
"...and the fully armed nuclear warheads, are, of course, merely a courtesy detail."
And they shall beat their swords into plowshares, for if you hit a man with a plowshare, he's going to know he's been hit.
Andrea: Unhappy the land that has no heroes. Galileo: No, unhappy the land that needs heroes.
wisdom.author: Bertolt Brecht, "Life of Galileo"

wisdom.sentence: Another such victory over the Romans, and we are undone.
wisdom.author: Pyrrhus

wisdom.sentence: Any excuse will serve a tyrant.
wisdom.author: Aesop

wisdom.sentence: Anybody that wants the presidency so much that he'll spend two years organising and campaigning for it is not to be trusted with the office.
wisdom.author: David Broder

wisdom.sentence: Anyone who is capable of getting themselves made President should on no account be allowed to do the job.
wisdom.author: Douglas Adams, "The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy"

wisdom.sentence: As long as war is regarded as wicked, it will always have its fascination. When it is looked upon as vulgar, it will cease to be popular.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde, "Intentions"

wisdom.sentence: Audacity, and again, audacity, and always audacity.
wisdom.author: G.J. Danton

wisdom.sentence: Ban the bomb.  Save the world for conventional warfare.
Be it our wealth, our jobs, or even our homes; nothing is safe while the legislature is in session.
Bedfellows make strange politicians.
Blessed are the young, for they shall inherit the national debt.
wisdom.author: Herbert Hoover

wisdom.sentence: C'est magnifique, mais ce n'est pas la guerre!  [It is magnificent, but it is not war]
wisdom.author: Pierre Bosquet, witnessing the charge of the Light Brigade

wisdom.sentence: "Cable is not a luxury, since many areas have poor TV reception."
wisdom.author: The mayor of Tucson, Arizona, 1989

wisdom.sentence: Canada Post doesn't really charge 32 cents for a stamp.  It's 2 cents for postage and 30 cents for storage.
wisdom.author: Gerald Regan, Cabinet Minister, 12/31/83 Financial Post

wisdom.sentence: Census Taker to Housewife: Did you ever have the measles, and, if so, how many?
Conquering Russia should be done steppe by steppe.
Corruption is not the #1 priority of the Police Commissioner.  His job is to enforce the law and fight crime.
wisdom.author: P.B.A. President E. J. Kiernan

wisdom.sentence: Crime does not pay ... as well as politics.
wisdom.author: Alfred E. Newman

wisdom.sentence: Demand the establishment of the government in its rightful home at Disneyland.
Democracy becomes a government of bullies, tempered by editors.
wisdom.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

wisdom.sentence: Democracy is a device that insures we shall be governed no better than we deserve.
wisdom.author: George Bernard Shaw

wisdom.sentence: Democracy is a form of government in which it is permitted to wonder aloud what the country could do under first-class management.
wisdom.author: Senator Soaper

wisdom.sentence: Democracy is a form of government that substitutes election by the incompetent many for appointment by the corrupt few.
wisdom.author: G.B. Shaw

wisdom.sentence: Democracy is a government where you can say what you think even if you don't think.
Democracy is a process by which the people are free to choose the man who will get the blame.
wisdom.author: Laurence J. Peter

wisdom.sentence: Democracy is good.  I say this because other systems are worse.
wisdom.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

wisdom.sentence: Democracy is the name we give the people whenever we need them.
wisdom.author: Arman de Caillavet, 1913

wisdom.sentence: Democracy is the recurrent suspicion that more than half of the people are right more than half of the time.
wisdom.author: E. B. White

wisdom.sentence: Democracy is the worst form of government except all those other forms that have been tried from time to time.
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill

wisdom.sentence: Democracy means simply the bludgeoning of the people by the people for the people.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: Demographic polls show that you have lost credibility across the board. Especially with those 14 year-old Valley girls.
Diplomacy is about surviving until the next century.  Politics is about surviving until Friday afternoon.
wisdom.author: Sir Humphrey Appleby

wisdom.sentence: Diplomacy is the art of letting the other party have things your way.
wisdom.author: Daniele Vare

wisdom.sentence: Diplomacy is the art of saying "nice doggie" until you can find a rock.
wisdom.author: Wynn Catlin

wisdom.sentence: Diplomacy is to do and say, the nastiest thing in the nicest way.
wisdom.author: Balfour

wisdom.sentence: Disclose classified information only when a NEED TO KNOW exists.
Don't be humble ... you're not that great.
wisdom.author: Golda Meir

wisdom.sentence: Don't mind him; politicians always sound like that.
Don't steal... the IRS hates competition!
Don't suspect your friends -- turn them in!
wisdom.author: "Brazil"

wisdom.sentence: Don't talk to me about naval tradition.  It's nothing but rum, sodomy and the lash.
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill

wisdom.sentence: Don't vote -- it only encourages them!
Due to a shortage of devoted followers, the production of great leaders has been discontinued.
Each person has the right to take the subway.
Ever wonder if taxation without representation might have been cheaper?
Every country has the government it deserves.
wisdom.author: Joseph De Maistre

wisdom.sentence: Everything is controlled by a small evil group to which, unfortunately, no one we know belongs.
Extremism in the defense of liberty is no vice... moderation in the pursuit of justice is no virtue.
wisdom.author: Barry Goldwater

wisdom.sentence: Fanaticism consists of redoubling your effort when you have forgotten your aim.
wisdom.author: George Santayana

wisdom.sentence: Fay: The British police force used to be run by men of integrity. Truscott: That is a mistake which has been rectified.
wisdom.author: Joe Orton, "Loot"

wisdom.sentence: Fear and loathing, my man, fear and loathing.
wisdom.author: H.S. Thompson

wisdom.sentence: For the first time we have a weapon that nobody has used for thirty years. This gives me great hope for the human race.
wisdom.author: Harlan Ellison

wisdom.sentence: Forgive him, for he believes that the customs of his tribe are the laws of nature!
wisdom.author: G.B. Shaw

wisdom.sentence: Fraud is the homage that force pays to reason.
wisdom.author: Charles Curtis, "A Commonplace Book"

wisdom.sentence: Free Speech Is The Right To Shout 'Theater' In A Crowded Fire.
wisdom.author: A Yippie Proverb

wisdom.sentence: Freedom begins when you tell Mrs. Grundy to go fly a kite.
Freedom is nothing else but the chance to do better.
wisdom.author: Camus

wisdom.sentence: Freedom of the press is for those who happen to own one.
Freedom's just another word for nothing left to lose.
wisdom.author: Kris Kristofferson, "Me and Bobby McGee"

wisdom.sentence: George Orwell 1984.  Northwestern 0.
wisdom.author: Chicago Reader 10/15/82

wisdom.sentence: George Orwell was an optimist.
George Washington was first in war, first in peace -- and the first to have his birthday juggled to make a long weekend.
wisdom.author: Ashley Cooper

wisdom.sentence: Give all orders verbally.  Never write anything down that might go into a "Pearl Harbor File".
"Give me enough medals, and I'll win any war."
wisdom.author: Napoleon

wisdom.sentence: Giving money and power to governments is like giving whiskey and car keys to teenage boys.
wisdom.author: P.J. O'Rourke

wisdom.sentence: God shows his contempt for wealth by the kind of person he selects to receive it.
wisdom.author: Austin O'Malley

wisdom.sentence: Good leaders being scarce, following yourself is allowed.
Govern a great nation as you would cook a small fish.  Don't overdo it.
wisdom.author: Lao Tsu

wisdom.sentence: Government [is] an illusion the governed should not encourage.
wisdom.author: John Updike, "Couples"

wisdom.sentence: Government lies, and newspapers lie, but in a democracy they are different lies.
Grub first, then ethics.
wisdom.author: Bertolt Brecht

wisdom.sentence: Hark ye, Clinker, you are a most notorious offender.  You stand convicted of sickness, hunger, wretchedness, and want.
wisdom.author: Tobias Smollet

wisdom.sentence: Have you noticed the way people's intelligence capabilities decline sharply the minute they start waving guns around?
wisdom.author: Dr. Who

wisdom.sentence: He didn't run for reelection.  "Politics brings you into contact with all the people you'd give anything to avoid," he said. "I'm staying home."
wisdom.author: Garrison Keillor, "Lake Wobegone Days"

wisdom.sentence: He is the best of men who dislikes power.
wisdom.author: Mohammed

wisdom.sentence: He that would govern others, first should be the master of himself.
He thinks the Gettysburg Address is where Lincoln lived.
wisdom.author: Wanda, "A Fish Called Wanda"

wisdom.sentence: He who attacks the fundamentals of the American broadcasting industry attacks democracy itself.
wisdom.author: William S. Paley, chairman of CBS

wisdom.sentence: He who renders warfare fatal to all engaged in it will be the greatest benefactor the world has yet known.
wisdom.author: Sir Richard Burton

wisdom.sentence: He who slings mud generally loses ground.
wisdom.author: Adlai Stevenson

wisdom.sentence: He's just a politician trying to save both his faces...
Hear me, my chiefs, I am tired; my heart is sick and sad.  From where the sun now stands I Will Fight No More Forever.
wisdom.author: Chief Joseph of the Nez Perce

wisdom.sentence: Here comes the orator, with his flood of words and his drop of reason.
History is on our side (as long as we can control the historians).
History is the version of past events that people have decided to agree on.
wisdom.author: Napoleon Bonaparte, "Maxims"

wisdom.sentence: History teaches us that men and nations behave wisely once they have exhausted all other alternatives.
wisdom.author: Abba Eban

wisdom.sentence: How can you govern a nation which has 246 kinds of cheese?
wisdom.author: Charles de Gaulle

wisdom.sentence: How is the world ruled, and how do wars start? Diplomats tell lies to journalists, and they believe what they read.
wisdom.author: Karl Kraus, "Aphorisms and More Aphorisms"

wisdom.sentence: I am a friend of the working man, and I would rather be his friend than be one.
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow

wisdom.sentence: I am not a politician and my other habits are also good.
wisdom.author: A. Ward

wisdom.sentence: I can hire one half of the working class to kill the other half.
wisdom.author: Jay Gould

wisdom.sentence: "I don't care who does the electing as long as I get to do the nominating."
wisdom.author: Boss Tweed

wisdom.sentence: I don't mind what Congress does, as long as they don't do it in the streets and frighten the horses.
wisdom.author: Victor Hugo

wisdom.sentence: I DON'T THINK I'M ALONE when I say I'd like to see more and more planets fall under the ruthless domination of our solar system.
wisdom.author: Jack Handley, The New Mexican, 1988.

wisdom.sentence: I find this corpse guilty of carrying a concealed weapon and I fine it $40.
wisdom.author: Judge Roy Bean, finding a pistol and $40 on a man he'd      just shot.

wisdom.sentence: I found Rome a city of bricks and left it a city of marble.
wisdom.author: Augustus Caesar

wisdom.sentence: I have already given two cousins to the war and I stand ready to sacrifice my wife's brother.
wisdom.author: Artemus Ward

wisdom.sentence: I have always noticed that whenever a radical takes to Imperialism, he catches it in a very acute form.
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill, 1903

wisdom.sentence: I have discovered the art of deceiving diplomats. I tell them the truth and they never believe me.
wisdom.author: Camillo Di Cavour

wisdom.sentence: I have gained this by philosophy: that I do without being commanded what others do only from fear of the law.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.sentence: I have never understood this liking for war.  It panders to instincts already catered for within the scope of any respectable domestic establishment.
wisdom.author: Alan Bennett

wisdom.sentence: I hold it, that a little rebellion, now and then, is a good thing...
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.sentence: I know not with what weapons World War III will be fought, but World War IV will be fought with sticks and stones.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.sentence: I might have gone to West Point, but I was too proud to speak to a congressman.
wisdom.author: Will Rogers

wisdom.sentence: I needed the good will of the legislature of four states.  I formed the legislative bodies with my own money.  I found that it was cheaper that way.
wisdom.author: Jay Gould

wisdom.sentence: I never deny, I never contradict.  I sometimes forget.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Disraeli, British PM, on dealing with the      Royal Family

wisdom.sentence: I never vote for anyone.  I always vote against.
wisdom.author: W.C. Fields

wisdom.sentence: I owe the government $3400 in taxes.  So I sent them two hammers and a toilet seat.
wisdom.author: Michael McShane

wisdom.sentence: I see a good deal of talk from Washington about lowering taxes.  I hope they do get 'em lowered down enough so people can afford to pay 'em.
wisdom.author: The Best of Will Rogers

wisdom.sentence: I think the world is run by C students.
wisdom.author: Al McGuire

wisdom.sentence: I trust the first lion he meets will do his duty.
wisdom.author: J.P. Morgan on Teddy Roosevelt's safari

wisdom.sentence: I try not to break the rules but merely to test their elasticity.
wisdom.author: Bill Veeck

wisdom.sentence: I try to keep an open mind, but not so open that my brains fall out.
wisdom.author: Judge Harold T. Stone

wisdom.sentence: I use not only all the brains I have, but all those I can borrow as well.
wisdom.author: Woodrow Wilson

wisdom.sentence: I want to be the white man's brother, not his brother-in-law.
wisdom.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

wisdom.sentence: I wish a robot would get elected president.  That way, when he came to town, we could all take a shot at him and not feel too bad.
wisdom.author: Jack Handley

wisdom.sentence: I would like to electrocute everyone who uses the word 'fair' in connection with income tax policies.
wisdom.author: William F. Buckley

wisdom.sentence: I would much rather have men ask why I have no statue, than why I have one.
wisdom.author: Marcus Procius Cato

wisdom.sentence: I would rather be a serf in a poor man's house and be above ground than reign among the dead.
wisdom.author: Achilles, "The Odessey", XI, 489-91

wisdom.sentence: I'd like to see the government get out of war altogether and leave the whole field to private industry.
wisdom.author: Joseph Heller

wisdom.sentence: "I'll rob that rich person and give it to some poor deserving slob. That will *prove* I'm Robin Hood."
wisdom.author: Daffy Duck, "Robin Hood Daffy", [1958, Chuck Jones]

wisdom.sentence: I'm going to Vietnam at the request of the White House.  President Johnson says a war isn't really a war without my jokes.
wisdom.author: Bob Hope

wisdom.sentence: "I'm not stupid, I'm not expendable, and I'M NOT GOING!"
I'm proud to be paying taxes in the United States.  The only thing is -- I could be just as proud for half the money.
wisdom.author: Arthur Godfrey

wisdom.sentence: "I'm willing to sacrifice anything for this cause, even other people's lives."
I've always considered statesmen to be more expendable than soldiers.
If built in great numbers, motels will be used for nothing but illegal purposes.
wisdom.author: J. Edgar Hoover

wisdom.sentence: If everybody minded their own business, the world would go around a deal faster.
wisdom.author: The Duchess, "Through the Looking Glass"

wisdom.sentence: If fifty million people say a foolish thing, it's still a foolish thing.
wisdom.author: Bertrand Russell

wisdom.sentence: If God had meant for us to be in the Army, we would have been born with green, baggy skin.
If God wanted us to have a President, He would have sent us a candidate.
wisdom.author: Jerry Dreshfield

wisdom.sentence: If Karl, instead of writing a lot about Capital, had made a lot of Capital, it would have been much better.
wisdom.author: Karl Marx's Mother

wisdom.sentence: If Patrick Henry thought that taxation without representation was bad, he should see how bad it is with representation.
If pro is the opposite of con, what is the opposite of progress?
If society fits you comfortably enough, you call it freedom.
wisdom.author: Robert Frost

wisdom.sentence: If the American dream is for Americans only, it will remain our dream and never be our destiny.
wisdom.author: Ren'e de Visme Williamson

wisdom.sentence: If the government doesn't trust the people, why doesn't it dissolve them and elect a new people?
"If the King's English was good enough for Jesus, it's good enough for me!"
wisdom.author: "Ma" Ferguson, Governor of Texas (circa 1920)

wisdom.sentence: If the rich could pay the poor to die for them, what a living the poor could make!
If they were so inclined, they could impeach him because they don't like his necktie.
wisdom.author: Attorney General William Saxbe

wisdom.sentence: If voting could change the system, it would be illegal.  If not voting could change the system, it would be illegal.
If we all work together, we can totally disrupt the system.
If we can ever make red tape nutritional, we can feed the world.
wisdom.author: R. Schaeberle, "Management Accounting"

wisdom.sentence: If we suffer tamely a lawless attack upon our liberty, we encourage it, and involve others in our doom.
wisdom.author: Samuel Adams

wisdom.sentence: If we won't stand together, we don't stand a chance.
If you don't strike oil in twenty minutes, stop boring.
wisdom.author: Andrew Carnegie, on public speaking

wisdom.sentence: "If you ever want to get anywhere in politics, my boy, you're going to have to get a toehold in the public eye."
If you give Congress a chance to vote on both sides of an issue, it will always do it.
wisdom.author: Les Aspin, D., Wisconsin

wisdom.sentence: If you go on with this nuclear arms race, all you are going to do is make the rubble bounce.
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill

wisdom.sentence: If you live in a country run by committee, be on the committee.
wisdom.author: Graham Summer

wisdom.sentence: If you make any money, the government shoves you in the creek once a year with it in your pockets, and all that don't get wet you can keep.
wisdom.author: The Best of Will Rogers

wisdom.sentence: If you took all of the grains of sand in the world, and lined them up end to end in a row, you'd be working for the government!
wisdom.author: Mr. Interesting

wisdom.sentence: If your hands are clean and your cause is just and your demands are reasonable, at least it's a start.
Imbalance of power corrupts and monopoly of power corrupts absolutely.
wisdom.author: Genji

wisdom.sentence: Immigration is the sincerest form of flattery.
wisdom.author: Jack Paar

wisdom.sentence: In America, any boy may become president and I suppose that's just one of the risks he takes.
wisdom.author: Adlai Stevenson

wisdom.sentence: In an orderly world, there's always a place for the disorderly.
In case of atomic attack, the federal ruling against prayer in schools will be temporarily canceled.
In defeat, unbeatable; in victory, unbearable.
wisdom.author: W. Churchill, on General Montgomery

wisdom.sentence: In fiction the recourse of the powerless is murder; in life the recourse of the powerless is petty theft.
In our civilization, and under our republican form of government, intelligence is so highly honored that it is rewarded by exemption from the cares of office.
wisdom.author: Ambrose Bierce, "The Devil's Dictionary"

wisdom.sentence: In Pierre Trudeau, Canada has finally produced a Prime Minister worthy of assassination.
wisdom.author: John Diefenbaker

wisdom.sentence: In the Halls of Justice the only justice is in the halls.
wisdom.author: Lenny Bruce

wisdom.sentence: In those days he was wiser than he is now -- he used to frequently take my advice.
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill

wisdom.sentence: In war it is not men, but the man who counts.
wisdom.author: Napoleon

wisdom.sentence: In war, truth is the first casualty.
wisdom.author: U Thant

wisdom.sentence: Individualists unite!
Indomitable in retreat; invincible in advance; insufferable in victory.
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill, on General Montgomery

wisdom.sentence: Inform all the troops that communications have completely broken down.
Inheritance taxes are getting so out of line, that the deceased family often doesn't have a legacy to stand on.
Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
wisdom.author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

wisdom.sentence: Interfere?  Of course we should interfere!  Always do what you're best at, that's what I say.
wisdom.author: Doctor Who

wisdom.sentence: It got to the point where I had to get a haircut or both feet firmly planted in the air.
It is better to die on your feet than to live on your knees.
It is better to wear chains than to believe you are free, and weight yourself down with invisible chains.
It is difficult to legislate morality in the absence of moral legislators.
It is easier to fight for one's principles than to live up to them.
wisdom.author: Alfred Adler

wisdom.sentence: It is enough to make one sympathize with a tyrant for the determination of his courtiers to deceive him for their own personal ends...
wisdom.author: Russell Baker and Charles Peters

wisdom.sentence: It is impossible to defend perfectly against the attack of those who want to die.
It is like saying that for the cause of peace, God and the Devil will have a high-level meeting.
wisdom.author: Rev. Carl McIntire, on Nixon's China trip

wisdom.sentence: It is now 10 p.m.  Do you know where Henry Kissinger is?
wisdom.author: Elizabeth Carpenter

wisdom.sentence: It may be better to be a live jackal than a dead lion, but it is better still to be a live lion.  And usually easier.
wisdom.author: Lazarus Long

wisdom.sentence: It pays in England to be a revolutionary and a bible-smacker most of one's life and then come round.
wisdom.author: Lord Alfred Douglas

wisdom.sentence: It seems a little silly now, but this country was founded as a protest against taxation.
It seems like the less a statesman amounts to, the more he loves the flag.
"It was a Roman who said it was sweet to die for one's country.  The Greeks never said it was sweet to die for anything.  They had no vital lies."
wisdom.author: Edith Hamilton, "The Greek Way"

wisdom.sentence: It was the Law of the Sea, they said.  Civilization ends at the waterline. Beyond that, we all enter the food chain, and not always right at the top.
wisdom.author: Hunter S. Thompson

wisdom.sentence: It's a good thing we don't get all the government we pay for.
It's a recession when your neighbour loses his job; it's a depression when you lose yours.
wisdom.author: Harry S. Truman

wisdom.sentence: It's getting uncommonly easy to kill people in large numbers, and the first thing a principle does -- if it really is a principle -- is to kill somebody.
wisdom.author: Dorothy L. Sayers, "Gaudy Night"

wisdom.sentence: It's important that people know what you stand for. It's more important that they know what you won't stand for.
It's no surprise that things are so screwed up: everyone that knows how to run a government is either driving taxicabs or cutting hair.
wisdom.author: George Burns

wisdom.sentence: It's the opinion of some that crops could be grown on the moon.  Which raises the fear that it may not be long before we're paying somebody not to.
wisdom.author: Franklin P. Jones

wisdom.sentence: Join in the new game that's sweeping the country.  It's called "Bureaucracy". Everybody stands in a circle.  The first person to do anything loses.
Join the army, see the world, meet interesting, exciting people, and kill them.
Join the Navy; sail to far-off exotic lands, meet exciting interesting people, and kill them.
Keep your laws off my body!
Know thyself.  If you need help, call the C.I.A.
L'etat c'est moi.  [I am the state.]
wisdom.author: Louis XIV

wisdom.sentence: Law stands mute in the midst of arms.
wisdom.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

wisdom.sentence: Lawful Dungeon Master -- and they're MY laws!
Let no guilty man escape.
wisdom.author: U.S. Grant

wisdom.sentence: Let the people think they govern and they will be governed.
wisdom.author: William Penn, founder of Pennsylvania

wisdom.sentence: Let us never negotiate out of fear, but let us never fear to negotiate.
wisdom.author: John F. Kennedy

wisdom.sentence: Liberty don't work as good in practice as it does in speeches.
wisdom.author: The Best of Will Rogers

wisdom.sentence: Liberty is always dangerous, but it is the safest thing we have.
wisdom.author: Harry Emerson Fosdick

wisdom.sentence: Life is a concentration camp.  You're stuck here and there's no way out and you can only rage impotently against your persecutors.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.sentence: Lots of folks are forced to skimp to support a government that won't.
Love America -- or give it back.
"MacDonald has the gift on compressing the largest amount of words into the smallest amount of thoughts."
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill

wisdom.sentence: Majorities, of course, start with minorities.
wisdom.author: Robert Moses

wisdom.sentence: Man is a military animal, glories in gunpowder, and loves parade.
wisdom.author: P.J. Bailey

wisdom.sentence: Man is by nature a political animal.
wisdom.author: Aristotle

wisdom.sentence: Many a bum show has been saved by the flag.
wisdom.author: George M. Cohan

wisdom.sentence: Massachusetts has the best politicians money can buy.
Message will arrive in the mail.  Destroy, before the FBI sees it.
Mickey Mouse wears a Spiro Agnew watch.
Military intelligence is a contradiction in terms.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.sentence: Military justice is to justice what military music is to music.
wisdom.author: Groucho Marx

wisdom.sentence: Most people want either less corruption or more of a chance to participate in it.
My experience with government is when things are non-controversial, beautifully co-ordinated and all the rest, it must be that not much is going on.
wisdom.author: J.F. Kennedy

wisdom.sentence: My father was a saint, I'm not.
wisdom.author: Indira Gandhi

wisdom.sentence: My folks didn't come over on the Mayflower, but they were there to meet the boat.
National security is in your hands - guard it well.
Necessity is the plea for every infringement of human freedom. It is the argument of tyrants; it is the creed of slaves.
wisdom.author: William Pitt, 1783

wisdom.sentence: Neglect of duty does not cease, by repetition, to be neglect of duty.
wisdom.author: Napoleon

wisdom.sentence: Nemo me impune lacessit.  [No one provokes me with impunity]
wisdom.author: Motto of the Crown of Scotland

wisdom.sentence: Never let your sense of morals prevent you from doing what is right.
wisdom.author: Salvor Hardin, "Foundation"

wisdom.sentence: Never trust an automatic pistol or a D.A.'s deal.
wisdom.author: John Dillinger

wisdom.sentence: "Never underestimate the power of a small tactical nuclear weapon."
Next to being shot at and missed, nothing is really quite as satisfying as an income tax refund.
wisdom.author: F. J. Raymond

wisdom.sentence: Nihilism should commence with oneself.
No man's ambition has a right to stand in the way of performing a simple act of justice.
wisdom.author: John Altgeld

wisdom.sentence: No matter whether th' constitution follows th' flag or not, th' supreme court follows th' iliction returns.
wisdom.author: Mr. Dooley

wisdom.sentence: No-one would remember the Good Samaritan if he had only had good intentions.  He had money as well.
wisdom.author: Margaret Thatcher

wisdom.sentence: Nothing is illegal if one hundred businessmen decide to do it.
wisdom.author: Andrew Young

wisdom.sentence: Now and then an innocent man is sent to the legislature.
"Nuclear war would mean abolition of most comforts, and disruption of  normal routines, for children and adults alike."
wisdom.author: Willard F. Libby, "You *Can* Survive Atomic Attack"

wisdom.sentence: "Nuclear war would really set back cable."
wisdom.author: Ted Turner

wisdom.sentence: Oh, I don't blame Congress.  If I had $600 billion at my disposal, I'd be irresponsible, too.
wisdom.author: Lichty & Wagner

wisdom.sentence: Old soldiers never die.  Young ones do.
Once you've seen one nuclear war, you've seen them all.
One nuclear bomb can ruin your whole day.
One of the lessons of history is that nothing is often a good thing to do and always a clever thing to say.
wisdom.author: Will Durant

wisdom.sentence: One organism, one vote.
One planet is all you get.
One seldom sees a monument to a committee.
Our swords shall play the orators for us.
wisdom.author: Christopher Marlowe

wisdom.sentence: Ours is a world of nuclear giants and ethical infants.
wisdom.author: General Omar N. Bradley

wisdom.sentence: Patriotism is the virtue of the vicious.
wisdom.author: Oscar Wilde

wisdom.sentence: Peace cannot be kept by force; it can only be achieved by understanding.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.sentence: Peace is much more precious than a piece of land... let there be no more wars.
wisdom.author: Mohammed Anwar Sadat, 1918-1981

wisdom.sentence: People never lie so much as after a hunt, during a war, or before an election.
wisdom.author: Otto Von Bismarck

wisdom.sentence: People of privilege will always risk their complete destruction rather than surrender any material part of their advantage.
wisdom.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

wisdom.sentence: People that can't find something to live for always seem to find something to die for.  The problem is, they usually want the rest of us to die for it too.
People usually get what's coming to them ... unless it's been mailed.
People who develop the habit of thinking of themselves as world citizens are fulfilling the first requirement of sanity in our time.
wisdom.author: Norman Cousins

wisdom.sentence: Persistence in one opinion has never been considered a merit in political leaders.
wisdom.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero, "Ad familiares", 1st century BC

wisdom.sentence: Pilfering Treasury property is paticularly dangerous: big thieves are ruthless in punishing little thieves.
wisdom.author: Diogenes

wisdom.sentence: Poland has gun control.
Political history is far too criminal a subject to be a fit thing to teach children.
wisdom.author: W.H. Auden

wisdom.sentence: Political speeches are like steer horns.  A point here, a point there, and a lot of bull inbetween.
wisdom.author: Alfred E. Neuman

wisdom.sentence: Political T.V. commercials prove one thing: some candidates can tell all their good points and qualifications in just 30 seconds.
Politicians are the same all over.  They promise to build a bridge even where there is no river.
wisdom.author: Nikita Khrushchev

wisdom.sentence: Politicians should read science fiction, not westerns and detective stories.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke

wisdom.sentence: Politicians speak for their parties, and parties never are, never have been, and never will be wrong.
wisdom.author: Walter Dwight

wisdom.sentence: Politics -- the gentle art of getting votes from the poor and campaign funds from the rich by promising to protect each from the other.
wisdom.author: Oscar Ameringer

wisdom.sentence: Politics and the fate of mankind are formed by men without ideals and without greatness.  Those who have greatness within them do not go in for politics.
wisdom.author: Albert Camus

wisdom.sentence: Politics are almost as exciting as war, and quite as dangerous.  In war, you can only be killed once.
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill

wisdom.sentence: Politics is not the art of the possible.  It consists in choosing between the disastrous and the unpalatable.
wisdom.author: John Kenneth Galbraith

wisdom.sentence: Politics makes strange bedfellows, and journalism makes strange politics.
wisdom.author: Amy Gorin

wisdom.sentence: Politics, as a practice, whatever its professions, has always been the systematic organisation of hatreds.
wisdom.author: Henry Adams, "The Education of Henry Adams"

wisdom.sentence: Politics, like religion, hold up the torches of matrydom to the reformers of error.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.sentence: Populus vult decipi.  [The people like to be deceived.]
Post proelium, praemium.  [After the battle, the reward.]
Postmen never die, they just lose their zip.
Poverty begins at home.
Poverty must have its satisfactions, else there would not be so many poor people.
wisdom.author: Don Herold

wisdom.sentence: Power corrupts.  Absolute power is kind of neat.
wisdom.author: John Lehman, Secretary of the Navy, 1981-1987

wisdom.sentence: Power is poison.
Power is the finest token of affection.
Power tends to corrupt, absolute power corrupts absolutely.
wisdom.author: Lord Acton, Letter, 5 April 1887

wisdom.sentence: Practical politics consists in ignoring facts.
wisdom.author: Henry Adams

wisdom.sentence: President Reagan has noted that there are too many economic pundits and forecasters and has decided on an excess prophets tax.
Put a rogue in the limelight and he will act like an honest man.
wisdom.author: Napoleon Bonaparte, "Maxims"

wisdom.sentence: Question authority.
QUESTION AUTHORITY.  (Sez who?)
Question: Is it better to abide by the rules until they're changed or help speed the change by breaking them?
Remember folks.  Street lights timed for 35 mph are also timed for 70 mph.
wisdom.author: Jim Samuels

wisdom.sentence: "Remember, if it's being done correctly, here or abroad, it's not the U.S. Army doing it!"
wisdom.author: Good Morning VietNam

wisdom.sentence: Reporter (to Mahatma Gandhi): Mr Gandhi, what do you think of Western  Civilization? Gandhi: I think it would be a good idea.
Reunite Gondwondaland!
Rule the Empire through force.
wisdom.author: Shogun Tokugawa

wisdom.sentence: Sauron is alive in Argentina!
Scrubbing floors and emptying bedpans has as much dignity as the Presidency.
wisdom.author: Richard Nixon

wisdom.sentence: Secrecy is the beginning of tyranny.
Sed quis custodiet ipsos Custodes?  [Who guards the Guardians?]
Serfs up!
wisdom.author: Spartacus

wisdom.sentence: Shah, shah!  Ayatollah you so!
Signs of crime: screaming or cries for help.
wisdom.author: The Brown University Security Crime Prevention Pamphlet

wisdom.sentence: Since a politician never believes what he says, he is surprised when others believe him.
wisdom.author: Charles DeGaulle

wisdom.sentence: Since aerosols are forbidden, the police are using roll-on Mace!
[Sir Stafford Cripps] has all the virtues I dislike and none of the vices I admire.
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill

wisdom.sentence: So many men, so many opinions; every one his own way.
wisdom.author: Publius Terentius Afer (Terence)

wisdom.sentence: Some men rob you with a six-gun -- others with a fountain pen.
wisdom.author: Woodie Guthrie

wisdom.sentence: Stamp out organized crime!!  Abolish the IRS.
Such a foolish notion, that war is called devotion, when the greatest warriors are the ones who stand for peace.
Support your local police force -- steal!!
Support your right to arm bears!!
Support your right to bare arms!
wisdom.author: A message from the National Short-Sleeved Shirt Association

wisdom.sentence: Take Care of the Molehills, and the Mountains Will Take Care of Themselves.
wisdom.author: Motto of the Federal Civil Service

wisdom.sentence: Take your Senator to lunch this week.
TANSTAAFL
Tax reform means "Don't tax you, don't tax me, tax that fellow behind the tree."
wisdom.author: Russell Long

wisdom.sentence: Taxes are going up so fast, the government is likely to price itself out of the market.
Taxes are not levied for the benefit of the taxed.
Ten persons who speak make more noise than ten thousand who are silent.
wisdom.author: Napoleon I

wisdom.sentence: That government is best which governs least.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau, "Civil Disobedience"

wisdom.sentence: The Army needs leaders the way a foot needs a big toe.
wisdom.author: Bill Murray

wisdom.sentence: The attacker must vanquish; the defender need only survive.
The avoidance of taxes is the only intellectual pursuit that carries any reward.
wisdom.author: John Maynard Keynes

wisdom.sentence: The better the state is established, the fainter is humanity. To make the individual uncomfortable, that is my task.
wisdom.author: Nietzsche

wisdom.sentence: The bureaucracy is expanding to meet the needs of an expanding bureaucracy.
The Constitution may not be perfect, but it's a lot better than what we've got!
The control of the production of wealth is the control of human life itself.
wisdom.author: Hilaire Belloc

wisdom.sentence: The Crown is full of it!
wisdom.author: Nate Harris, 1775

wisdom.sentence: The danger is not that a particular class is unfit to govern.  Every class is unfit to govern.
wisdom.author: Lord Acton

wisdom.sentence: The degree of civilization in a society can be judged by entering its prisons.
wisdom.author: F. Dostoyevski

wisdom.sentence: The distinction between Freedom and Liberty is not accurately known; naturalists have been unable to find a living specimen of either.
wisdom.author: Ambrose Bierce

wisdom.sentence: The doctrine of human equality reposes on this: that there is no man really clever who has not found that he is stupid.
wisdom.author: Gilbert K. Chesterson

wisdom.sentence: The end move in politics is always to pick up a gun.
wisdom.author: Buckminster Fuller

wisdom.sentence: The eyes of taxes are upon you.
The famous politician was trying to save both his faces.
The first duty of a revolutionary is to get away with it.
wisdom.author: Abbie Hoffman

wisdom.sentence: The founding fathers tried to set up a judicial system where the accused received a fair trial, not a system to insure an acquittal on technicalities.
The government has just completed work on a missile that turned out to be a bit of a boondoggle; nicknamed "Civil Servant", it won't work and they can't fire it.

The Government just announced today the creation of the Neutron Bomb II. Similar to the Neutron Bomb, the Neutron Bomb II not only kills people and leaves buildings standing, but also does a little light housekeeping.
The graveyards are full of indispensable men.
wisdom.author: Charles de Gaulle

wisdom.sentence: The greatest dangers to liberty lurk in insidious encroachment by men of zeal, well-meaning but without understanding.
wisdom.author: Justice Louis D. Brandeis

wisdom.sentence: The greatest disloyalty one can offer to great pioneers is to refuse to move an inch from where they stood.
The hardest thing in the world to understand is the income tax.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.sentence: The health of a democratic society may be measured by the quality of functions performed by private citizens.
wisdom.author: Alexis de Tocqueville

wisdom.sentence: The inherent vice of capitalism is the unequal sharing of blessings; the inherent virtue of socialism is the equal sharing of misery.
wisdom.author: Churchill

wisdom.sentence: The law will never make men free; it is men who have got to make the law free.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.sentence: The less a statesman amounts to, the more he loves the flag.
wisdom.author: Kin Hubbard

wisdom.sentence: The lion and the calf shall lie down together but the calf won't get much sleep.
wisdom.author: Woody Allen

wisdom.sentence: "The Lord gave us farmers two strong hands so we could grab as much as we could with both of them."
wisdom.author: Joseph Heller, "Catch-22"

wisdom.sentence: The majority of the stupid is invincible and guaranteed for all time.  The terror of their tyranny, however, is alleviated by their lack of consistency.
wisdom.author: Albert Einstein

wisdom.sentence: The man who follows the crowd will usually get no further than the crowd.  The man who walks alone is likely to find himself in places no one has ever been.
wisdom.author: Alan Ashley-Pitt

wisdom.sentence: The mark of the immature man is that he wants to die nobly for a cause, while the mark of a mature man is that he wants to live humbly for one.
wisdom.author: Wilhelm Stekel

wisdom.sentence: The Moral Majority is neither.
The more control, the more that requires control.
The more you sweat in peace, the less you bleed in war.
The new Congressmen say they're going to turn the government around.  I hope I don't get run over again.
The Official Colorado State Vegetable is now the "state legislator".
The only winner in the War of 1812 was Tchaikovsky.
wisdom.author: David Gerrold

wisdom.sentence: The poetry of heroism appeals irresitably to those who don't go to a war, and even more so to those whom the war is making enormously wealthy."
wisdom.author: Celine

wisdom.sentence: The politician is someone who deals in man's problems of adjustment. To ask a politician to lead us is to ask the tail of a dog to lead the dog.
wisdom.author: Buckminster Fuller

wisdom.sentence: The price of greatness is responsibility.
The price of seeking to force our beliefs on others is that someday they might force their beliefs on us.
wisdom.author: Mario Cuomo

wisdom.sentence: The problem with most conspiracy theories is that they seem to believe that for a group of people to behave in a way detrimental to the common good requires intent.
The problem with this country is that there is no death penalty for incompetence.
The public demands certainties;  it must be told definitely and a bit raucously that this is true and that is false. But there are no certainties.
wisdom.author: H.L. Mencken, "Prejudice"

wisdom.sentence: The public is an old woman.  Let her maunder and mumble.
wisdom.author: Thomas Carlyle

wisdom.sentence: The Puritan hated bear-baiting, not because it gave pain to the bear, but because it gave pleasure to the spectators.
wisdom.author: Thomas Macaulay, "History of England"

wisdom.sentence: The revolution will not be televised.
"The Right Honorable Gentleman is indebted to his memory for his jests and to his imagination for his facts."
wisdom.author: Sheridan

wisdom.sentence: The rule is, jam to-morrow and jam yesterday, but never jam today.
wisdom.author: Lewis Carroll

wisdom.sentence: The scum also rises.
wisdom.author: Dr. Hunter S. Thompson

wisdom.sentence: The so-called lessons of history are for the most part the rationalizations of the victors.  History is written by the survivors.
wisdom.author: Max Lerner

wisdom.sentence: The time for action is past!  Now is the time for senseless bickering.
The two oldest professions in the world have been ruined by amateurs.
wisdom.author: G.B. Shaw

wisdom.sentence: The universe is ruled by letting things take their course.  It cannot be ruled by interfering.
wisdom.author: Chinese proverb

wisdom.sentence: "The wages of sin are death; but after they're done taking out taxes, it's just a tired feeling:"
The way I understand it, the Russians are sort of a combination of evil and incompetence... sort of like the Post Office with tanks.
wisdom.author: Emo Philips

wisdom.sentence: The world's great men have not commonly been great scholars, nor its great scholars great men.
wisdom.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes

wisdom.sentence: There appears to be irrefutable evidence that the mere fact of overcrowding induces violence.
wisdom.author: Harvey Wheeler

wisdom.sentence: There are a lot of lies going around... and half of them are true.
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill

wisdom.sentence: There are no manifestos like cannon and musketry.
wisdom.author: The Duke of Wellington

wisdom.sentence: There are only two things in this world that I am sure of, death and taxes, and we just might do something about death one of these days.
wisdom.author: shades

wisdom.sentence: There are two kinds of fool. One says, "This is old, and therefore good." And one says, "This is new, and therefore better"
wisdom.author: John Brunner, "The Shockwave Rider"

wisdom.sentence: There but for the grace of God, goes God.
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill, speaking of Sir Stafford Cripps.

wisdom.sentence: There can be no daily democracy without daily citizenship.
wisdom.author: Ralph Nader

wisdom.sentence: There cannot be a crisis next week.  My schedule is already full.
wisdom.author: Henry Kissinger

wisdom.sentence: There is a certain impertinence in allowing oneself to be burned for an opinion.
wisdom.author: Anatole France

wisdom.sentence: There is hopeful symbolism in the fact that flags do not wave in a vacuum.
wisdom.author: Arthur C. Clarke

wisdom.sentence: There is Jackson standing like a stone wall.  Let us determine to die, and we will conquer.  Follow me.
wisdom.author: General Barnard E. Bee (CSA)

wisdom.sentence: There is no act of treachery or mean-ness of which a political party is not capable; for in politics there is no honour.
wisdom.author: Benjamin Disraeli, "Vivian Grey"

wisdom.sentence: There is no education that is not political.  An apolitical education is also political because it is purposely isolating.
There is no satisfaction in hanging a man who does not object to it.
wisdom.author: G.B. Shaw

wisdom.sentence: There is no security on this earth.  There is only opportunity.
wisdom.author: General Douglas MacArthur

wisdom.sentence: There is one difference between a tax collector and a taxidermist -- the taxidermist leaves the hide.
wisdom.author: Mortimer Caplan

wisdom.sentence: There is only one way to kill capitalism -- by taxes, taxes, and more taxes.
wisdom.author: Karl Marx

wisdom.sentence: There is perhaps in every thing of any consequence, secret history, which it would be amusing to know, could we have it authentically communicated.
wisdom.author: James Boswell

wisdom.sentence: There never was a good war or a bad peace.
wisdom.author: B. Franklin

wisdom.sentence: There's no trick to being a humorist when you have the whole government working for you.
wisdom.author: Will Rogers

wisdom.sentence: There's nothing in the middle of the road but yellow stripes and dead armadillos.
wisdom.author: Jim Hightower, Texas Agricultural Commissioner

wisdom.sentence: They call them "squares" because it's the most complicated shape they can deal with.
"They make a desert and call it peace."
wisdom.author: Tacitus (55?-120?)

wisdom.sentence: "They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary safety deserve neither liberty nor safety."
wisdom.author: Benjamin Franklin, 1759

wisdom.sentence: They will only cause the lower classes to move about needlessly.
wisdom.author: The Duke of Wellington, on early steam railroads.

wisdom.sentence: They're giving bank robbing a bad name.
wisdom.author: John Dillinger, on Bonnie and Clyde

wisdom.sentence: Thieves respect property; they merely wish the property to become their property that they may more perfectly respect it.
wisdom.author: G.K. Chesterton, "The Man Who Was Thursday"

wisdom.sentence: This is a country where people are free to practice their religion, regardless of race, creed, color, obesity, or number of dangling keys...
"Those who do not do politics will be done in by politics."
wisdom.author: French Proverb

wisdom.sentence: Those who have had no share in the good fortunes of the mighty Often have a share in their misfortunes.
wisdom.author: Bertolt Brecht, "The Caucasian Chalk Circle"

wisdom.sentence: Those who have some means think that the most important thing in the world is love. The poor know that it is money.
wisdom.author: Gerald Brenan

wisdom.sentence: To be excellent when engaged in administration is to be like the North Star.  As it remains in its one position, all the other stars surround it.
wisdom.author: Confucius

wisdom.sentence: To make tax forms true they should read "Income Owed Us" and "Incommode You".
To say you got a vote of confidence would be to say you needed a vote of confidence.
wisdom.author: Andrew Young

wisdom.sentence: To think contrary to one's era is heroism.  But to speak against it is madness.
wisdom.author: Eugene Ionesco

wisdom.sentence: To use violence is to already be defeated.
wisdom.author: Chinese proverb

wisdom.sentence: Today is a good day to bribe a high-ranking public official.
Too often I find that the volume of paper expands to fill the available briefcases.
wisdom.author: Governor Jerry Brown

wisdom.sentence: Travel important today;  Internal Revenue men arrive tomorrow.
Treaties are like roses and young girls -- they last while they last.
wisdom.author: Charles DeGaulle

wisdom.sentence: True leadership is the art of changing a group from what it is to what it ought to be.
wisdom.author: Virginia Allan

wisdom.sentence: Under a government which imprisons any unjustly, the true place for a just man is also a prison.
wisdom.author: Henry David Thoreau

wisdom.sentence: Under any conditions, anywhere, whatever you are doing, there is some ordinance under which you can be booked.
wisdom.author: Robert D. Sprecht, Rand Corp.

wisdom.sentence: Under capitalism, man exploits man.  Under communism, it's just the opposite.
wisdom.author: J.K. Galbraith

wisdom.sentence: Under every stone lurks a politician.
wisdom.author: Aristophanes

wisdom.sentence: Unquestionably, there is progress.  The average American now pays out twice as much in taxes as he formerly got in wages.
wisdom.author: H. L. Mencken

wisdom.sentence: Usually, when a lot of men get together, it's called a war.
wisdom.author: Mel Brooks, "The Listener"

wisdom.sentence: Veni, vidi, vici.  [I came, I saw, I conquered].
wisdom.author: Gaius Julius Caesar

wisdom.sentence: Very few things happen at the right time, and the rest do not happen at all.  The conscientious historian will correct these defects.
wisdom.author: Herodotus

wisdom.sentence: Victory uber allies!
Violence is a sword that has no handle -- you have to hold the blade.
Violence is molding.
Violence is the last refuge of the incompetent.
wisdom.author: Salvor Hardin

wisdom.sentence: Vote anarchist.
War doesn't prove who's right, just who's left.
War hath no fury like a non-combatant.
wisdom.author: Charles Edward Montague

wisdom.sentence: War is an equal opportunity destroyer.
War is delightful to those who have had no experience of it.
wisdom.author: Desiderius Erasmus

wisdom.sentence: War is like love, it always finds a way.
wisdom.author: Bertolt Brecht, "Mother Courage"

wisdom.sentence: War is much too serious a matter to be entrusted to the military.
wisdom.author: Clemenceau

wisdom.sentence: War is peace.  Freedom is slavery.  Ketchup is a vegetable.
War spares not the brave, but the cowardly.
wisdom.author: Anacreon

wisdom.sentence: [Washington, D.C.] is the home of... taste for the people -- the big, the bland and the banal.
wisdom.author: Ada Louise Huxtable

wisdom.sentence: Washington, D.C: Fifty square miles almost completely surrounded by reality.
We all declare for liberty, but in using the same word we do not all mean the same thing.
wisdom.author: A. Lincoln

wisdom.sentence: We are all born equal... just some of us are more equal than others.
We are all worms.  But I do believe I am a glowworm.
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill

wisdom.sentence: We cannot do everything at once, but we can do something at once.
wisdom.author: Calvin Coolidge

wisdom.sentence: We have not inherited the earth from our parents, we've borrowed it from our children.
We should have a Vollyballocracy.  We elect a six-pack of presidents. Each one serves until they screw up, at which point they rotate.
wisdom.author: Dennis Miller

wisdom.sentence: We the unwilling, led by the ungrateful, are doing the impossible. We've done so much, for so long, with so little, that we are now qualified to do something with nothing.
We totally deny the allegations, and we're trying to identify the allegators.
We'll try to cooperate fully with the IRS, because, as citizens, we feel a strong patriotic duty not to go to jail.
wisdom.author: Dave Barry

wisdom.sentence: Well, he didn't know what to do, so he decided to look at the government, to see what they did, and scale it down and run his life that way.
wisdom.author: Laurie Anderson

wisdom.sentence: What a strange game.  The only winning move is not to play.
wisdom.author: WOP, "War Games"

wisdom.sentence: What I want is all of the power and none of the responsibility.
What is the robbing of a bank compared to the founding of a bank?
wisdom.author: Bertold Brecht

wisdom.sentence: What is the sound of one hand clapping?
What orators lack in depth they make up in length.
What we need is either less corruption, or more chance to participate in it.
What's a cult? It just means not enough people to make a minority.
wisdom.author: Robert Altman

wisdom.sentence: When a man assumes a public trust, he should consider himself as public property.
wisdom.author: Thomas Jefferson

wisdom.sentence: When asked by an anthropologist what the Indians called America before the white men came, an Indian said simply "Ours."
wisdom.author: Vine Deloria, Jr.

wisdom.sentence: When I came back to Dublin I was courtmartialed in my absence and sentenced to death in my absence, so I said they could shoot me in my absence.
wisdom.author: Brendan Behan

wisdom.sentence: When I hear a man applauded by the mob I always feel a pang of pity for him.  All he has to do to be hissed is to live long enough.
wisdom.author: H.L. Mencken, "Minority Report"

wisdom.sentence: When I was a boy I was told that anybody could become President.  Now I'm beginning to believe it.
wisdom.author: Clarence Darrow

wisdom.sentence: When in doubt, do what the President does -- guess.
When neither their poverty nor their honor is touched, the majority of men live content.
wisdom.author: Niccolo Machiavelli

wisdom.sentence: When smashing monuments, save the pedstals -- they always come in handy.
wisdom.author: Stanislaw J. Lem, "Unkempt Thoughts"

wisdom.sentence: When some people decide it's time for everyone to make big changes, it means that they want you to change first.
When taxes are due, Americans tend to feel quite bled-white and blue.
When the government bureau's remedies don't match your problem, you modify the problem, not the remedy.
When the revolution comes, count your change.
When we are planning for posterity, we ought to remember that virtue is not hereditary.
wisdom.author: Thomas Paine

wisdom.sentence: When you go into court you are putting your fate into the hands of twelve people who weren't smart enough to get out of jury duty.
wisdom.author: Norm Crosby

wisdom.sentence: When you have an efficient government, you have a dictatorship.
wisdom.author: Harry Truman

wisdom.sentence: When you have to kill a man it costs nothing to be polite.
wisdom.author: Winston Churchill, on formal declarations of war

wisdom.sentence: When you live in a sick society, just about everything you do is wrong.
When you say that you agree to a thing in principle, you mean that you have not the slightest intention of carrying it out in practice.
wisdom.author: Otto Von Bismarck

wisdom.sentence: When you're in command, command.
wisdom.author: Admiral Nimitz

wisdom.sentence: Whenever I hear anyone arguing for slavery, I feel a strong impulse to see it tried on him personally.
wisdom.author: Abraham Lincoln

wisdom.sentence: Where the system is concerned, you're not allowed to ask "Why?".
Where you stand depends on where you sit.
wisdom.author: Rufus Miles, HEW

wisdom.sentence: Why bother building any more nuclear warheads until we use the ones we have?
Why can't you be a non-conformist like everyone else?
... with liberty and justice for all ... who can afford it.
Workers of the world, arise!  You have nothing to lose but your chairs.
World War Three can be averted by adherence to a strictly enforced dress code!
"Wrong," said Renner.  "The tactful way," Rod said quietly, "the polite way to disagree with the Senator would be to say, `That turns out not to be the case.'"
You can have peace.  Or you can have freedom. Don't ever count on having both at once.
wisdom.author: Lazarus Long

wisdom.sentence: You have all the characteristics of a popular politician: a horrible voice, bad breeding, and a vulgar manner.
wisdom.author: Aristophanes

wisdom.sentence: You roll my log, and I will roll yours.
wisdom.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

wisdom.sentence: You should never wear your best trousers when you go out to fight for freedom and liberty.
wisdom.author: Henrik Ibsen
